meanings.definition: To program (a computer or other machine) again.
meanings.sent1: I reprogramed my robot to dance.
meanings.sent2: She reprogramed the alarm clock to wake her up earlier.
meanings.sent3: The computer got reprogramed to tell jokes all day.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a computer, easily reprogramed with new information.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reprogramed the robot to perform complex tasks.

meanings.definition: To change the programming of (a computer or other machine).
meanings.sent1: They reprogramed the vending machine to accept new coins.
meanings.sent2: The technician reprogramed the thermostat for better energy efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The toaster was reprogramed to burn toast on purpose.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt reprogramed after the breakup, like a machine with a new code.
meanings.sent5: The hacker reprogramed the security system to grant unauthorized access.
